text: The Jerusalem Post is a broadsheet newspaper based in Jerusalem. It was founded in 1932 during the British Mandate of Palestine by Gershon Agron as The Palestine Post. In 1950, it changed its name to The Jerusalem Post.‘Maariv’ Newspaper to Be Sold to Businessman Eli Azur News flash at israelnationalnews.com The newspaper is published in English and also printed a French edition. ==References== Category:Jerusalem Category:1930s establishments in Israel Category:1932 establishments in Asia Category:Newspapers in Asia
title: The Jerusalem Post
